alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 4:14PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ MONDAY TO 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sheridan, Eastern Cherry and Western Cherry Counties. Highest snow totals along and north of highway 20, lower amounts to the south. * WHEN...From 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ Monday to 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow with whiteout conditions expected. Strong winds could cause tree damage and scattered power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold temperatures with wind chill values 5 to 10 below zero especially Tuesday night and Wednesday night.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
